meanings.definition: A small, round pastry typically filled with fruit or cream.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious clumpet with my tea this morning.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sells various flavors of clumpets every day.
meanings.sent3: As I bit into the clumpet, the filling squirted out and landed on my shirt.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as round and sweet as a freshly baked clumpet.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the warm clumpet filled the room, making my mouth water.

meanings.definition: To gather or form into a compact mass.
meanings.sent1: I clumpeted the fallen leaves into a pile in the yard.
meanings.sent2: The children clumpeted together to discuss their plan.
meanings.sent3: He clumpeted his toys into a messy tower that kept falling over.
meanings.sent4: The dancers clumpeted into a tight circle on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The students clumpeted around the teacher to hear the exciting news.

meanings.sent1: The clumpet of glue held the pieces together firmly.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally stepped in a clumpet of mud on the path.
meanings.sent3: The clumpet of honey dripped slowly from the spoon onto the toast.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds formed a clumpet in the sky before the storm.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a clumpet of sauce to the dish, enhancing its flavor.
